frontmatter.title: Automated Analysis of Parkinson’s Disease with Remote Tasks

node.html:
Parkinson’s disease (PD) is a neuro-degenerative disorder that is usually observed among elderly people with symptoms like shaking, slowness and stiffness, difficulty with walking and balance. Timely diagnosis and treatment can improve the quality of life for PD patients. However, access to clinical diagnosis is limited in low and middle income countries (LMICs). We developed an innovative automated PD screening tool using Positive Unlabeled Learning that uses webcam-recorded videos, addressing noisy data in healthcare and improving accessibility to diagnosis.

Lead Investigator

Status : Phase 1 review passed. Under Phase 2 review in AAAI '24
Recreational Animations created using Manim
Coding Game Spring Challenge 2020

frontmatter.title: Quartet Fiduccia-Mattheyses Revisited for Larger Phylogenetic Studies

node.html:
Our proposed method QFM-FI, a faster and improved version of the Quartet Fiduccia and Mattheyses algorithm, can amalgamate millions of quartets over thousands of taxa into a species tree with a great level of accuracy, which can be used for large-scale phylogeny estimation. This enhanced version achieves a speedup of 20,000x compared to its predecessor and 400x when compared with the widely utilized variant of QFM implemented in PAUP*. Furthermore, a comparative study was conducted on both simulated and actual biological datasets to evaluate the performance of QFM-FI with state-of-the-art methods. The study exhibited that QFM-FI outperforms QFM with regards to running time and tree quality while producing trees that are comparable to state-of-the-art methods. Worked on providing a theoretical analysis of the running time and memory requirements of QFM-FI.

Status : Accepted at Bioinformatics (Oxford University Press) Journal!

Deep Dive into the 3D world with RTX-ON

Implemented a ray tracing pipeline from scratch. Phong Lighting Model and Recursive Relfection is used for proper lighting and ray tracting.

A tech interview preparation platform

IntDesk is an all-in-one tech interview preperation platform. Here the users can not only solve problems that are asked in interviews of different software companies, but also can take assessments and earn different badges to showcase their skills. They can also discuss about interview problems and many more topics!

Active Queue Management in ns3

Implemented Stabilized RED (SRED) Algorithm in ns3. Like RED (Random Early Detection), SRED pre-emptively discards packets with a load-dependent probability when a buffer in a router in the Internet or an Intranet seem congested.

Also implemented an extended custom version of mine where timestamp of the incoming packets is also considered in our algorithm and the probability to overwrite is adjusted accordingly. This is called here Extended Stabilized RED or ESRED in short. The performance was better than its SRED counterpart.

A platform where you can find all the latest tech deals and offers

Designed the system ground-up by building BPMN, Class and ER Diagram, Collaboration Diagram, Sequence Diagram and Mock UI. Also implemented a demo module.

Memory Management using Paging Framework for Xv6 Operating System

Xv6 OS doesn't support paging framework for memory management. Implemented the paging framework as part of Operating System course.

A Generic Wordle Solver

Using Genetic Algorithm to solve wordle like games for any length of words.

A subset C Compiler

Made using flex, bison and a lot of patience. A lot of compiler code optimization is also implemented. The code is accompanied with some tips and tricks, and a small tutorial.

Notification for Moodle

Moodle doesn't come with built-in notification system. So I created one, synced with a discord bot. This helped my fellow university students to get quick notification from Moodle
